sentences.sContent: It’s unusual for Dave to be late.
(= it is quite common ) to feel very angry in a situation like this.
sentences.sCn: 遇到这样的情况觉得非常生气是很正常的。

sentences.sContent: ...A young woman sought explanation from a brain scientist when she noticed her unusual memory...
...people with this rare condition often find their unusual ability burdensome...
...One simple check would be to program a robot to check the correct course of action with a human when presented with an unusual situation...
...unless he is very unusual and very lucky...

synos.tran: 不寻常的；与众不同的；不平常的

remMethod.val: un(不) ＋ usual(平常的) → 不平常的

words.tran: 非常；异乎寻常地；显著地

trans.tranCn: 不平常的， 少有的； 独特的， 与众不同的
trans.tranOther: different from what is usual or normal
